> OOC: Sorry, scrath my last post about the possesion, it could be much
better.
>
>
>     Black Aracnia left Darkmouse with the drone and passed by Quickstrike.
> She was exhausted and Quickstrike was seconed in command....
>     "Quickstrike? Do me a favor and take command for an hour. I need a
quick
> nap. Ill be in my quarters. Let Venomous in with that bot. Thanks." She
said,
> very sleepily.
>     With that, she made her way into her large penthouse quarters and
crawled
> into her bed, in beast mode of course. Curled up tightly, she drifted to
> sleep.
>
>     Moments passed and she was in a surreal realm, one that often haunted
> her. It was a dark place deep within the ship. She could hear him walking,
> slamming about. It scared her more than anything else in the entire
creation.
>     She began to run in her robot mode as fast as she could. Aracnia began
to
> panic, she heard him stomping behinde her. It was hard to run in this
dream,
> it might have been because it took place in a rusty old engin room filled
> with obsticles and bad lighting. Or it could have been because the fear of
> Tarantulas was absolutely terrifying.
>     He stalked her like he was the spider, which he was, and she was the
fly,
> which she didnt like at all. He gave his hideous rhaspy cackle that made
her
> fall onto the floor. Aracnia knew she couldnt get away now. She was as
good
> as his.
>     The form of Tarantulas was different in this nightmare. He was a
giant,
> fully amred, and totally furious. Useing his right claw he ripped apart a
> group of pipes and stood before Aracnia as the steam from the broken pipes
> whirled around his hulky body.
>     Opening her mouth to scream would do nothing, nor would useing her
wepon.
> He was in control of this real, despite it was really her dream. Last time
> she tried to imagine herself his size, with more wepons, but it failed
> miserably.
>     "Ah, I have caught you widow! Hehehehehe!" He cackled, "now you will
help
> me or I shall plauge your mind forever!" His voice boomed like thunder in
the
> dream.
>     "Wh-what are you talking about?" She stammered frantically.
>     He laughed agian, this time holding himself and stomping the floor,
which
> made her fly into the air. Aracnia landed with a hard thud.
>     "You will restore my body for me. If you havent guessed, when the Vok
> destroyed me ever so long ago, my conscience was transmitted here.
> Unfortunetly it was locked in your subconscience. Now that I have finally
> caught you, I have broken free. The tourture was nessecery, belive me." He
> rhasped as Aracnia shivered with fear.
>     "I can now talk to you directly from your mind. But, I can not control
> you. So, if you dont do as i say I can guarentee you will never slumber
> agian! Every time you close your eyes I will be there. Do we have a deal?"
He
> hissed.
>     "Alright. Once you got your body, you leave?" She said, a little more
> relived.
>     "Yes. Thats the deal. My body is in peices in the storeage room. Put
it
> together and I will be able to depart from you and go through with my own
> affiars." The spider said. It seemed he was getting smaller, now that
Aracnia
> seemed less afraid.
>     "Fine. Now, let me go. You'll get what you need." SHe said, and it
echoed
> because the spider, the room, and everything around her suddenly swirled
> around her and she was awake, sitting in bed, shakeing.
>     Aracnia had a mission. To free Tarantulas from her body. It appears
that
> his clone knew about him, but left him in her banks. That bastard. She was
> glad Transantulas was gone, because if he was here she would have killed
him.
>
>
